There are some who will not hear. So long have they chosen to follow their own way and their own wisdom, so long have they cherished defective hereditary and cultivated tendencies of character, that they are blind, and cannot see afar off. By them, principles are perverted; false standards are raised; tests are made that bear not the signature of heaven. Thus many of God's professed people are assimilating worldly ideas and forming characters that will exclude them from heaven. And yet some of these very ones make their boasts in the Lord 


                                  -167- 

as a people who do righteousness, and forsake not the ordinances of their God.--Ms 138, 1902. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Dec. 17, 1987. Entire Ms.
